intro: Oxygonum cordofanum, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and vibrant, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Oxygonum cordofanum is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
